meanings.definition: To place (something) back in its original spot.
meanings.sent1: After playing with his toys, Tim always respots them on the shelf.
meanings.sent2: She respotted the vase on the table after dusting it.
meanings.sent3: The forgetful squirrel respotted his acorn in the wrong tree.
meanings.sent4: The gardener respotted the wilting plant, hoping it would thrive.
meanings.sent5: The librarian respotting books on the shelves made the library look neat and organized.

meanings.definition: The act of putting something back in its original position.
meanings.sent1: The respotting of the picture frame made the room look complete.
meanings.sent2: She always does the respotting of the items on the display shelves.
meanings.sent3: The respotting of the misplaced keys brought relief to the forgetful owner.
meanings.sent4: The respotting of the fallen leaves in the garden was a tedious task.
meanings.sent5: The respotting of the fallen dominoes created a satisfying pattern on the table.
